head.title: A Senator Blocks Money for Peace

hedline.hl1: A Senator Blocks Money for Peace

abstract.p: Letter from Emmett Barcalow says it is intolerable that one person, Sen Judd Gregg, acting alone, can block total of $368 million in payment to United Nations for peacekeeping operations (May 20 article)

block.p: Re ''Solitary Republican Senator Blocks Peacekeeping Funds'' (front page, May 20): Rule by the majority is supposed to be an essential component of a robust democracy. What kind of democracy do we have when one individual, elected by a minuscule portion of the American electorate, has the power unilaterally to veto vital foreign policy initiatives?

Re ''Solitary Republican Senator Blocks Peacekeeping Funds'' (front page, May 20): Rule by the majority is supposed to be an essential component of a robust democracy. What kind of democracy do we have when one individual, elected by a minuscule portion of the American electorate, has the power unilaterally to veto vital foreign policy initiatives?

It is intolerable that Judd Gregg, the chairman of the Senate Appropriations Subcommittee, acting alone, can block $368 million in payment to the United Nations for peacekeeping operations. Senate rules that permit this ultimately poison democracy.
